Text: Brandon Rigney From Rigney Brandon Sent Tuesday October PM To Taylor Michael E Subject Google sales contact Here it is Hi Brandon Thanks for your interest in a Google advertising program If you would send me your phone number I will call you to explain a little more about the Google advertising program and opportunities for Enron Best regards John John DiCola Google Inc Regional Sales Manager North Michigan Avenue Chicago IL P F wwwgooglecom

RE HGA ruleIf I had to be more descriptive I would say the following The NOx allowances reflect allocated emissions from the Mass Emissions Cap and Trade Program allocated to Enrons Methanol Plant located in Pasadena Texas Original Message From Bruce Robert Sent Thursday November PM To Taylor Michael E Subject RE HGA rule This is an example of a description from a contract in which we purchased DERCs from Dow Chemical The NOX DERCs reflect reductions of NOX emissions resulting from the shutdown of Boilers at Sellers LHC facility located in Freeport Texas the LHC Facility Could you provide something more descriptive along those lines thanks Bob Original Message From Taylor Michael E Sent Thursday November PM To Bruce Robert Subject RE HGA rule Enron Methanol Plant Original Message From Bruce Robert Sent Thursday November PM To Taylor Michael E Subject RE HGA rule thanks what is the particular EOTT facility that the reductions will relate to Original Message From Taylor Michael E Sent Thursday November PM To Woods Trevor Bruce Robert Massey II John Subject HGA rule c The owner or operator of a site receiving allowances on an annual basis may permanently sell those rights to any person This request for transfer of ownership shall be completed by the executive director following the submission of a completed ECT Form Application for Permanent Transfer of Allowance Ownership The executive director will issue a letter to the purchaser and seller reflecting this transaction The transaction will be considered finalized upon issuance of this letter The above is from Title Part CH Subchapter H Division Rule Texas Administrative Code Michael Taylor

RE GEA RaineyGEA Rainey is located in OK There are no emission trading programs in OK Original Message From Woods Trevor Sent Thursday November PM To King Lucy Cc Taylor Michael E Subject RE GEA Rainey probably not mike t Original Message From King Lucy Sent Wednesday November PM To Woods Trevor Cc Taylor Michael E Subject GEA Rainey Trevor GEA Rainey manufactures air cooled heat exchangers at a facility in Oklahoma Would they haveuse Emission credits Company GEA Rainey Corporation Industry Air Cooled Heater Exchangers Enron Owner Jerry Thomas PrivatePublic Private MWBE No Business Overview Designs and markets air cooled heat exchangers GEA Rainey is a wholly owned subsidiary of GEA AG the worlds largest heat transfer equipment company All manufacturing is done within facility Business Areas Design and fabrication of heat transfer equipment including forced and induced draft air cooled heat exchangers hydrocarbon process and steam condensers engine radiators turbine lube oil coolers natural gas and vapor coolers combustion preheaters and flue gas reheaters After market products and services including replacement air moving parts replacement finned tubes replacement finned tubes bundles field service thermal performance evaluation field service noise testing field service vibration testingelimination field service process controls enhancements and field service process upgrade recommendations CustomersIndustry Served Engineering and Construction firms refineries chemical and petrochemical plants power companies and utilities and other related industries worldwide Key Corporate Statistics Headquarters West Channel Road Catoosa OK wwwgearaineycom Locations Worldwide Employees Executive Leadership Financials RevenuesSales MM Total Assets NA Net Income RE referee questionPaul Can we get a breakdown of how much Enron gives to soccer and what does it pay for Original Message From Gregory Paul Sent Monday November PM To Alonso Mario Bennett Joel Bennett Peter Brent Jason Cangucu Andre Cross Richard Esbona Jorge Garza Ernesto Giannone Adam Gregory Paul James Matthew Jens Felipe Melinchon Ermes Monroy Gabriel Pearce Barry Poulson Marc Rostant Justin Servat Russell Sunar Alper Taylor Michael E Velez Luis Subject referee question A proposal has been brought forward regarding next season Do we want to have refs at the game ie a referee and linesmen The cost would increase from a game to ish a game Some teams have suggested that this is not necessary as this is in fact a recreational league I tend to agree Let me know your thoughts and I will pass them on to the league

RE GEA RaineyNot much said about our group except he has a direct line to Walley and has spoken with Dynegy He feels like they are excited to get us and that they mentioned that they are good at being number He also mentioned a few companies have asked if the coal group was for sale as a whole He listened but told them no thanks Sounds like a few small changes in our group but nothing drastic George did say we have working capital we didnt for days Not sure if that means coal or coal and emissions Didnt specify what groups will be hit the hardest he only said EGM and EIM Oh by the way my job offers are pouring as well To many to count It is hard to do work with all the head hunters calling him every hour Oh wait just kidding Original Message From Woods Trevor Sent Monday November PM To Taylor Michael E Subject RE GEA Rainey Makes sense Im sure he does Ive got my self and there is a larger need for experienced coal traders What groups will be hit hardest and did he provide any FW COP Outcomes Conference Call Nov Do you want me to go to this I was planning on going Lisa called me today Original Message From Jacobson Lisa Sent Monday November AM To Terraso Michael Keeler Jeff Schoen Mary Bolton Stacey Macphee Mike Stubbings Randy Mainzer Elliot Mitchell Heather Woods Trevor Taylor Michael E Badger Dan Dindarova Nailia McGrath Niamh McKalipThompson Catherine Phillips Marc Worthen Susan Lei Wayne Hamling Kimberly Grimes Michael Jensen Ruth Cc Oliver John Bauer Kate Loy Brian Wilson Jan Tripp Garrett Van Henry Eghneim Gus Thome Jennifer Churbock Scott Subject COP Outcomes Conference Call Nov COP Outcomes Conference Call CONFIRMATION You are confirmed to participate in a COP Outcomes conference call tomorrow November at am Central Time As you know broad rules for international greenhouse gas emissions trading and projectbased programs under the Kyoto Protocol were adopted Clean Development Mechanism and Joint Implementation at the Seventh Conference of the Parties to the UNFCCC this month Agenda Overview of outcomes of COP Decisions impacting priority issues Q A and next steps For participants in Houston we will meet in EB C Host Lisa Jacobson Confirmation Number US Dial In International DialIn Passcode Lisa Jacobson Enron Manager Environmental Strategies Eye Street NW Suite Washington DC Phone Fax

some infoDuke University football practice was delayed for two hours yesterday in the midst of what was an anthrax scare One of the players while on his way to the locker room happened to look down and notice a unknown white powdery substance on the practice field Thirdyear Blue Devils head coach Carl Franks immediately suspended practice while the FBI was called in to investigate After a complete field analysis the FBI determined that the white substance unknown to the players was the goal line Practice was resumed when FBI special agents decided that the Blue Devils winless in their last games would not be likely to encounter the substance ever ever again Jason Morrow Arlington Va

NOx SIP CALL BalanceTrevor This email is attempting to answer the request made by you and Scott a few weeks ago Attached are my projected balance for NOx SIP CALL It is based on numbers from EEA environment consultants EPA website NOx SIP Call model and new generation database The confidence level for overall balance is not that high The OTR states only need to reduce from to to be in compliance They have some SCRs already built and the plans for the other SCRs needed The nonOTR states are far more dirty than the OTR states The big question mark is the cost of technology that will be available for the states I believe that there will be a demand for allowances I believe the NOx SIP Call market to be a short at this point People think it is worse than it really is Also I can make a price forecast The confidence level would be low on the price forecast What else do you want here Mike Taylor

NOx OTR flow controlFYI Below is written by our environmental consultant EEA Based on the preliminary emissions data for just released the allowance surplus for this year is tons bringing the total bank at the end of the year to tons This would mean a flow control value of or a discount factor of for The exact flow controldiscount values cannot be calculated right now because they will depend on how many banked allowances are used for compliance this year and also on the implementation of the Maryland consent decree which the state and EPA probably wont figure out until next year But we are pretty much in that range
